programming_languages.name: Python
programming_languages.syntax: Python has a clean and easy-to-read syntax that uses indentation to define code blocks.
programming_languages.main_features: Python is known for its simplicity, versatility, and a vast standard library. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including object-oriented, imperative, and functional.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: Python is widely used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, automation, and scripting.

programming_languages.name: JavaScript
programming_languages.syntax: JavaScript uses curly braces to define code blocks and is primarily used as a scripting language for web development.
programming_languages.main_features: JavaScript is a versatile language that runs on the client-side (in web browsers) and server-side (with Node.js). It allows dynamic, interactive content on websites.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: JavaScript is essential for front-end web development, creating interactive user interfaces, and building web applications.

programming_languages.name: Java
programming_languages.syntax: Java uses semicolons to end statements and curly braces for code blocks. It follows an object-oriented programming (OOP) paradigm.
programming_languages.main_features: Java is platform-independent and known for its write-once, run-anywhere capability (WORA). It has a robust standard library and strong community support.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: Java is widely used for developing enterprise applications, Android mobile apps, backend services, and large-scale systems.

programming_languages.name: C++
programming_languages.syntax: C++ is a superset of the C programming language and uses semicolons to end statements.
programming_languages.main_features: C++ supports object-oriented, procedural, and generic programming. It provides direct memory access and control, making it efficient for system-level programming.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: C++ is commonly used for game development, system software, embedded systems, and performance-critical applications.

programming_languages.name: Swift
programming_languages.syntax: Swift has a modern and concise syntax inspired by several programming languages.
programming_languages.main_features: Swift is designed for safety and performance, offering features like optionals and automatic memory management.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: Swift is the primary language for iOS and macOS app development, and it is becoming popular for server-side applications.

programming_languages.name: Ruby
programming_languages.syntax: Ruby uses simple and elegant syntax with significant whitespace.
programming_languages.main_features: Ruby emphasizes simplicity and productivity. It follows the principles of "Convention over Configuration" and "Don't Repeat Yourself" (DRY).
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: Ruby is commonly used for web development, especially with the Ruby on Rails framework.

programming_languages.name: Go (Golang)
programming_languages.created_by: Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson
programming_languages.syntax: Go has a C-like syntax with explicit curly braces for code blocks.
programming_languages.main_features: Go is designed for efficiency and simplicity. It has built-in support for concurrency with Goroutines and Channels.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: Go is used for backend development, cloud services, networking, and distributed systems.

programming_languages.name: C#
programming_languages.syntax: C# has a syntax similar to Java and C++, using semicolons to end statements and curly braces for code blocks.
programming_languages.main_features: C# is a language developed by Microsoft for its .NET platform. It supports object-oriented programming and has a robust standard library.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: C# is commonly used for Windows application development, game development with Unity, and enterprise software.

programming_languages.name: PHP
programming_languages.syntax: PHP syntax is similar to C and Perl, and it is embedded within HTML to create dynamic web pages.
programming_languages.main_features: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development. It offers extensive database support and is easy to learn.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: PHP is widely used for web development to create dynamic websites, content management systems (CMS), and e-commerce platforms.

frameworks_libraries.name: CodeIgniter
frameworks_libraries.created_by: EllisLab, British Columbia Institute of Technology

programming_languages.name: C
programming_languages.syntax: C has a simple syntax with semicolons to end statements and curly braces for code blocks.
programming_languages.main_features: C is a general-purpose programming language known for its efficiency and low-level memory manipulation capabilities.
programming_languages.popular_use_cases: C is commonly used for system programming, embedded systems, firmware development, and operating systems.
